poem:
Title: "Chasing the Echo of Civil Tongues"

In the morning paper, a bet whispered,
Racist drums pounding in corners of talk shows,
Leaders rowing back, adrift in muddied waters.
A thousand pounds, an offer to wager for flight or plight,
Yet, he declined - not a betting man, or perhaps,
Not a leader for a thousand hypothetical hearts,
A sea of displaced souls in the political morning light.
